name: Chmod
title: This quick reference cheat sheet provides a brief overview of file permissions, and the operation of the chmod command

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This quick reference cheat sheet provides a brief overview of file permissions, and the operation of the chmod command

cards.title: Syntax
cards.body:
```shell script
$ chmod [options] <permissions> <file>

cards.code:
#### Example

```shell
$ chmod 755 foo.txt
$ chmod +x cheatsheets.py
$ chmod u-x cheatsheets.py
$ chmod u=rwx,g=rx,o= cheatsheets.sh

cards.body: The%20%60chmod%60%20command%20stands%20for%20%22change%20mode%22

Chmod Generator allows you to quickly and visually generate permissions in numerical and symbolic.

cards.title: Common Permissions
cards.body:
| Command | s         | Meaning                      |
| ------- | --------- | ---------------------------- |
| `400`   | r-------- | Readable by owner only       |
| `500`   | r-x------ | Avoid Changing               |
| `600`   | rw------- | Changeable by user           |
| `644`   | rw-r--r-- | Read and change by user      |
| `660`   | rw-rw---- | Changeable by user and group |
| `700`   | rwx------ | Only user has full access    |
| `755`   | rwxr-xr-x | Only changeable by user      |
| `775`   | rwxrwxr-x | Sharing mode for a group     |
| `777`   | rwxrwxrwx | Everybody can do everything  |

cards.title: Explains
cards.code:
$ ls -l
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 3 Jun 29 15:35 a.log
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 2 Jun 30 18:06 dir

cards.title: Objects
cards.body:
| Who (abbr.) | Meaning            |
| ----------- | ------------------ |
| `u`         | `U`ser             |
| `g`         | `G`roup            |
| `o`         | `O`thers           |
| `a`         | `A`ll, same as ugo |

cards.title: Permissions
cards.body:
| Abbreviation | Permission    | Value |
| ------------ | ------------- | ----- |
| `r`          | `R`ead        | 4     |
| `w`          | `W`rite       | 2     |
| `x`          | E`x`ecute     | 1     |
| `-`          | No permission | 0     |

cards.title: File Types
cards.body:
| Abbreviation | File Type       |
| ------------ | --------------- |
| `d`          | `D`irectory     |
| `-`          | Regular file    |
| `l`          | Symbolic `L`ink |

cards.title: Operators
cards.body:
| Symbol | Description |
| ------ | ----------- |
| `+`    | Add         |
| `-`    | Remove      |
| `=`    | Set         |

cards.title: chmod 600
cards.code:
$ chmod 600 example.txt
$ chmod u=rw,g=,o= example.txt
$ chmod a+rwx,u-x,g-rwx,o-rwx example.txt

cards.title: chmod 664
cards.code:
$ chmod 664 example.txt
$ chmod u=rw,g=rw,o=r example.txt
$ chmod a+rwx,u-x,g-x,o-wx example.txt

cards.title: chmod 777
cards.code:
$ chmod 777 example.txt
$ chmod u=rwx,g=rwx,o=rwx example.txt
$ chmod a=rwx example.txt

cards.title: Symbolic mode
cards.body: Deny execute permission to everyone.
Allow read permission to everyone.
Make a file readable and writable by the group and others.
Make a shell script executable by the user/owner.
Allow everyone to read, write, and execute the file and turn on the set group-ID.

cards.title: SSH Permissions
cards.body:
```shell script
$ chmod 700 ~/.ssh
$ chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
$ chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
$ chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
$ chmod 400 /path/to/access_key.pem

cards.code:
### Web Permissions

```shell script
$ chmod -R 644 /var/www/html/
$ chmod 644 .htaccess
$ chmod 644 robots.txt
$ chmod 755 /var/www/uploads/
$ find /var/www/html -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \;
